data.text:
In today’s time where people prefer to read English books, there are still some who find solace in Hindi literature. Students might think that reading Hindi books or novels might be boring and that they might get stuck on difficult words. But what they wouldn’t know is that reading Hindi books can cause great improvement in your vocabulary and grammar. As students know that Hindi is a rich language and Hindi literature includes both classical and modern works. It is a great source to gain insights into Indian culture. Not only that, the literary works can improve your language skills and thinking.

Some of the gems of Hindi literature are Munshi Premchand, Mahadevi Verma, Ramdhari Singh Dinkar, Devaki Nandan Khatri, Phanishwar Nath, Harivansh Rai Bachchan and many more. Here we have provided a curated list of the best Hindi books to read for students.

Best Hindi Books To Read For Students

This list includes the best works in Hindi from both prose and poetry. These are considered to be the gems of Hindi language and people continue to read them even today. Let us take a look at the list.

1.Godaan

Author- Premchand

Genre- Fiction

Summary- This work by Munshi Premchand is considered to be one of the greatest Hindi novels of all time. The plot revolves around a poor and up-righteous farmer Hori and his family. The novel explores the issues of poverty, exploitation of the poor, plight of farmers and socio-economic deprivation.

More works by author- Gaban, Nirmala, Rangbhoomi

Also Check- Top 10 Fiction Books For Students: From Romance to Crime, This List Has Got It All!

2.Gunahon Ka Devta

Author- Dharamvir Bharati

Genre- Fiction

Summary- Guhanhon Ka Devta was published in 1949. The story is set against the backdrop of the British rule in india. This work by Bharati is loved by readers for its representation of humans and their emotions. The story revolves around the protagonist, Chander and the woman he loves, Sudha. Dive into this masterpiece to experience the complexity of relationships, doomed love, societal constraints and sacrifice.

More works by author- Suraj ka Satwan Goda, Andha Yug, Bandh Gali Ka Aakhiri Makan

3.Tamas

Author- Bhisham Sahni

Genre- Fiction

Summary- Tamas is an extremely powerful account of the partition of India. It is the poignant story of the protagonist, an innocent sweeper, who is deceived by a politician. Sahni explores how poor people are trapped into carrying out the dirty work of the powerful.

More works by author- Basanti, Madhavi, Bhagya Rekha

4.Madhushala

Author- Harivansh Rai Bachchan

Genre- Poetry

Summary- When it comes to Hindi poetry, this is the first work that comes to mind. Madhushala is one of the most popular works of Hindi literature. It is a beautiful reflection of the complexities that life engages us with. The poet has used the metaphor of intoxication to delve into the themes of the meaning of life and death.

More works by author- Need ka Nirman Phir, Nisha Nimantran

5.Kamayani

Author- Jaishankar Prasad

Genre- Epic poetry

Summary- Kamayani is an iconic work and an epic poem. With the help of graphics, it delves into the conflict which humans often face between emotions and mind. The poet has refered to figures from ancient literature.

More works by author- Titli, Lahar, Kankal

6.Raat Pashmine Ki

Author- Gulzar

Genre- Poetry

Summary- If you want to read something by contemporary poets, pick up this beauty! This work is Gulzar at his absolute best. Through his provoking writing, he will make you experience various emotions.

More works by author- Pluto, Pukhraj

Pick up any one of these classics and get enchanted by the beauty of Hindi literature. Put on your reading glasses and happy reading!
